author: Pratham Nagpal
content: BharatPe’s former MD and cofounder Ashneer Grover has reportedly written to the RBI requesting an investigation into the shareholding of the fintech unicorn. Grover said in the letter addressed to RBI governor Shaktikanta Das, dated March 6, that BharatPe has deliberately “defrauded” the regulator by bringing back Bhavik Koladiya to the company’s cap table, after securing a few licenses.
title: Ashneer Grover seeks RBI probe into BharatPe's shareholding

author: Mansi Agarwal
content: BharatPe's ex-MD Ashneer Grover has written a letter to RBI, asking for a probe into the company's shareholding, ET reported. BharatPe "defrauded" RBI by bringing back Co-founder Bhavik Koladiya, who was convicted of wire fraud in US, to the company's cap table, the letter said. Grover asked RBI to revoke all licences of BharatPe if the company is found guilty.
title: Ashneer Grover asks RBI to probe BharatPe's shareholding: Report

author: System User
content: In a recent reel on his Instagram page 'layman_2_lawman', the Lawyer explained that if the executor of a 'will' marries after the execution of that 'will', then that 'will' automatically gets revoked as per Section 69 of the Indian Succession Act. He also shared a case where exact same thing had happened.
title: 'Will' executed gets revoked automatically: Advocate Deepak Somani

author: Nakul Ahuja
content: Union Minister Smriti Irani has reacted to reports suggesting Congress' Rahul Gandhi will contest from two seats in the Lok Sabha polls. "Why are people who say that Amethi is the Gandhi family's bastion taking...time to announce a candidate?" she asked. "If he's contesting on two seats, it means...he's announcing his loss from Amethi even before elections," she stated.
title: Rahul stating Amethi defeat before polls: Irani on 2 seats reports

author: ReferSMS Partner
content: Sidharth Malhotra and Raashii Khanna's enchanting duet 'Tere Sang Ishq Hua' is now available! Produced by Dharma Productions, this collaboration with Arijit Singh sets the mood for their upcoming film 'Yodha,' hitting cinemas on March 15th. The song captures their chemistry, promising a romantic journey. Fans eagerly anticipate the film's release alongside this captivating melody.
title: Sidharth & Raashii’s romantic ballad ‘Tere Sang Ishq Hua’ out now

author: Sumit Channa
content: Indian skipper Rohit Sharma became the first player in cricket history to achieve an elusive feat on Thursday. The stalwart registered the historic record on the first day of the fifth and final Test match against England in Dharamsala. Rohit became the first player to take 60 or more catches in all the three formats of cricket.
title: Rohit Sharma becomes first player to achieve elusive record

author: Nidhi Sinha
content: AAP MLA Somnath Bharti said his BJP rival from New Delhi, Bansuri Swaraj, was fugitive businessman Lalit Modi's lawyer. Bharti added, "Who helped him in running away?...Her name is Bansuri Swaraj. Lalit Modi thanked Swaraj on X (Twitter)." "Did BJP ask...Swaraj to help Lalit?" Bharti asked. Calling the claims "baseless", BJP's Praveen Kapoor called Bharti a person with "misogynistic mentality".
title: Who helped Lalit Modi escape India? Bansuri Swaraj: AAP rival

author: Sports Gaga Partner
content: In a touching moment, Ravichandran Ashwin allowed teammate Kuldeep Yadav to lead Team India off the field after Yadav's remarkable performance in the fifth Test against England. Despite Ashwin's milestone 100th match, he insisted Yadav take the lead, showcasing humility and camaraderie. This gesture captured hearts, highlighting the unity and respect within the Indian cricket team.
title: Ashwin’s heartening gesture towards Kuldeep leaves fans in awe

author: Ankush Verma
content: According to the 'Future of Pay 2024' report by EY, e-commerce is expected to have the highest salary growth in 2024 at 10.9%, followed by financial services with a projected growth of 10.1%. Professional services' salary is projected to grow by 10% and increments in real estate and infrastructure sector are projected at 10%.
title: What will be the salary increase in various sectors in India in 2024 as per EY?

author: Sakshita Khosla
content: A Microsoft Corporation engineer has claimed that the company's AI image generation tool, Copilot Designer, is frequently generating "inappropriate" images, including "sexually objectified" images of women. Shane Jones wrote to FTC saying it is being marketed as a safe AI tool for everyone, including children, despite the company being aware of its "systemic issues".
title: 'Sexualised' pics of women being generated by Microsoft AI tool, warns engineer
